intro: Cephalaria syriaca subsp. emigrans, commonly known as the Emigrant's cephalaria, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant features finely divided, grass-like leaves and produces yellow to orange disk flowers surrounded by ray florets. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or limestone habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and gardeners alike.
